data.title: Great for lunch
data.text: Very good sandwiches on super fresh bread! Located in quaint downtown Lakeville. Their coffee and baked goods are also nice and fresh. Have not been there after hours to try the wine bar.

data.title: Nice place, good food, friendly, clean
data.text:
This is a nifty little coffee shop cafe, that has a wine bar in the evening. It is in an old building that they have fixed up, you have to look for it kind of hard because it really blends into the town. It's grey with white trim on the east side of the street. 
I went for lunch two days in a row when I was taking a taking a workshop nearby. 
Nice fresh salads and made to order sandwiches. They offer lots of combinations with soups salads and sandwiches. 
Friendly helpful service.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Atmosphere is comfortable. Prices are reasonable for the amount of food you receive. Ingredients are fresh.  Staff is pretty friendly.  Visited at lunchtime and it was fairly busy.

data.title: Food is good!
data.text: Have only tried the lunch and coffee menu.  All the sandwiches, wraps and salads have been very good!

data.title: great spot
data.text: This is a great spot for coffee and conversation during the day and for wine and conversation evenings.  They have a nice selection of wines and beers.

data.title: Food is OK.  Wine list is better
data.text: Cute spot for downtown Lakeville.  Not a destination for food per se.  Nice place to meet a girlfriend for a little nosh over a glass of wine.

data.title: Main Street Wine Bar
data.text:
A nice spot for a good selection of wines.  Nothing outstanding, but good values.
The food is "small plate" and snack fare.  
Usually quiet where you can have a good conversation.

data.title: Great cafe!
data.text: Main Street has amazing wraps, good paninis and tasty soups with fast service.  The area also turns into a wine bar in the evenings.  This is a a great local business to support.

data.title: Good Alternative
data.text: Nice, quite hidden cafe, although it is a little expensive for what you get.  Not quite a destination restaurant.

data.title: One of my favs!
data.text: Love this place. It's such a breath of fresh air in comparison to the other dining/bar options. Plenty of wine and beer options. Wine flights available. Friendly staff and it's always super clean. The light plate options look really good.

data.title: Best Lunch In Town
data.text: My friend and I meet here to have lunch and go to the Farmer's Market. They have very good coffee, teas, and other drinks. Their treats are wonderful, and their sandwich menu is great. My favorite is the bacon egg salad on multi-grain bread.

data.title: Nice place to grab a bite for lunch
data.text:
Little cafe in downtown area.  Serves wraps, sandwiches, salads and soups.  Walk in and order at the register.  They will bring you your food.  Run by two women on the day we were there.  Bare bones staffing.  They were busy with walk-in as well as phone-in orders for pick up.

All the food was delicious and prepared to order.

data.title: So nice to have a local coffee/light lunch option in Lakeville
data.text: Mainstreet Coffee is a nice break from all of the suburban coffee chains.  The employees are super nice and the paninis on the lunch menu are great.  It is usually quiet and there is nice atmosphere during the daytime if you want to linger with a friend over coffee and/or lunch.  The full menu for lunch is actually quite extensive, but it is not posted in its entirety on the wall so you need to ask for a paper copy to see all the options.   I have not tried the wine bar portion at night, but I will in the future.

data.title: One of my favorites.
data.text: Love this place.   Atmosphere is great.  It's quaint, cozy and dependable.   One of my favorite places to catch up with friends.  Good food and great wine.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: I have lived in Lakeville all my life and have continued to come back to mainstreet in the summer hoping the service would improve, it hasn't. The workers are rude and unhelpful, the food is good but overpriced for sandwiches and smoothies.

data.title: Outstanding wines, tasty small plates
data.text: We'ver stayes in Lakeville a few times over the years, visiting a student in Northfield. We really regret not finding Mainstreet After Hours earlier! The wine list is outstanding, with many varietals, almost all available by the glass. The small-plate food offerings are creative and well-prepared. The owner is friendly and knowledgeable (she steered us to a special off-menu Malbec), the service is attentive, and the setting is great - an old bank building, with wines stored in the former vault. This is a big-city wine bar in terms of quality with a small-town setting and ambiance. Highly recommended for locals, St. Olaf/Carleton visitors, or anyone needing a respite from I-35.

data.title: Great Neighborhood Wine Bar
data.text: Love After Hours...a great selection of unique wine and beers and good food too.  A favorite place to gather with friends and neighbors.  Fabulous relaxed, comfortable and cozy atmosphere...I could stay for hours and often do!

data.title: Good catering options
data.text: We appreciate the convenience of the boxed lunches available for meetings.  LOVED the homemade cookies!  The sandwiches and wraps had a good assortment and our group enjoyed them.  I'm eager to try their other menu options and their 'after hours' wine club & small plates!

data.title: Finally, a wine bar that will make it!
data.text: My wife and I went on a date to have some wine and lite eats. We order 2 flights of wine, a red and a white. What a treat to experience wines we've never tried before. We sat outside and enjoyed the atmosphere as much as the wine. The service staff was excellent and knew their stuff. We ordered the cheese and cracker sampler and thoroughly enjoyed it. We look forward to going back soon, this time with some wine friends.

data.title: Great home town Coffee Shop, Cafe and Wine Bar!
data.text:
While we've been going to the Cafe for years and like their coffee, baked goods, and sandwiches, the addition of the wine bar has made the place even better.  The Cafe is open during the day, and on the other side of the building, the Wine Bar is open at night.  The same owner and same kitchen are involved for both.  We really like small local establishments, and this one is overlooked too often, because there isn't much going on downtown Lakeville at night.  If you are considering the Lakeville area for coffe, a light meal, or cocktail time, don't forget this is easy to get to on main street downtown, with plenty of parking, and the quality is high.  In the summer they have a great patio area.

The wine bar has a good selection of wine and beer.  There are many snacks, salads, and sandwiches available if you like.  On our last visit we had two beers (a microbrew Porter from Wisconsin and an Amber Ale from Colorado) , Hot Southern Peanuts, Blue Chips (kettle chips with chunky blue cheese dressing for dipping), and Warmed Olives (5 different types of olives).  Be careful with the Blue Chips - they are addictive - hard to stop eating!  The olives are really good too.  The total was right about $20 with tip included.  

The ambience is nice - it is a cozy little place that is usually quiet.  Good for "date night" with your spouse, or a small gathering of friends for Happy Hour, or after dinner.  Or if you just want something light, you can go there for dinner.  I've had the artichoke dip, flatbread, and sandwiches before, and they are all good.
